New Records: James Rodríguez equalized Carlos Valderrama’s record of 11 assists in South American World Cup qualifying.
James Rodríguez equalized Falcao García’s mark of 13 goals in World Cup qualifying.
Key Match Events: James Rodríguez scored from the penalty spot and had an assist to help Colombia edge Argentina 2-1.
Yerson Mosquera opened the scoring for Colombia with a close-range header in the 25th minute.
Nico Gonzalez equalized for Argentina in the 48th minute after intercepting a Rodríguez pass.
James Rodríguez secured the win for Colombia with a penalty in the 60th minute, awarded after a video review.
Post-Match Reflections: James Rodríguez commented on the tough weather conditions and praised the team's performance.
Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni mentioned the heat's impact on the match and the unfavorable conditions for a spectacle.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Metropolitano Stadium in Barranquilla.
This was the first time Colombia beat Argentina since 2019.
